Suite.SuiteDescription: Terms that every application should support

Event.DirectParamDescription: Objects to open. Can be a list of files or an object specifier.

Parameter.ParameterDescription: restrict to a particular fork (default is anyFork)
specify if the file should be opened in read-only mode (by default it is not)
specifies whether or not changes should be saved before closing

Event.EventDescription: Return the number of elements of a particular class within an object
Event.DirectParamDescription: the object whose elements are to be counted

Parameter.ParameterDescription: the class of the elements to be counted

Event.EventDescription: Return the size in bytes of an object
Event.ReplyDescription: the size of the object in bytes
Event.DirectParamDescription: the object whose data size is to be returned

Event.ReplyDescription: true if it exists, false if not

Event.EventDescription: Get the data for an object
Event.DirectParamDescription: the object whose data is to be returned

Event.ReplyDescription: Object specifier for the new element

Parameter.ParameterDescription: the class of the new element
Properties of the element. Some properties are required ('file' when creating a new map, 'type' when creating a new resource).
the initial data for the element
the file in which to save the object(s)
the file type of the document in which to save the data

Event.EventDescription: Revert an object to the most recently saved version

Property.PropertyDescription: Has the document been modified since the last save?
the boundary rectangle for the window
does the window have a close box?
does the window have a title bar?

Enumerator.EnumeratorDescription: Ask the user whether to save

Event.EventDescription: Duplicate one or more resource(s) in the resource map. The duplicate is automatically attributed an unique ID.
Event.ReplyDescription: a specifier for the duplicated resource(s)

Parameter.ParameterDescription: specifies which kind of editor to use (if not specified, Rezilla tries to find successively an interface, a template or the hexadecimal editor)

Event.EventDescription: export a rezmap document in a specific format

Parameter.ParameterDescription: the file in which to save the export (it must already exist)
specifies the export format (default is XML)

Event.EventDescription: display info about the specified resource in the Inspector window
Event.DirectParamDescription: Resource object to display info about.

Class.ClassDescription: a resource map document (representing the contents of an entire fork)

Property.PropertyDescription: the number of the document among other map documents
the reference number of the map in memory
the fork this document is editing (data fork or resource fork)
the resource map associated with this document
the file on disk corresponding to this resource map document

Class.ClassDescription: an editor document for a single resource

Property.PropertyDescription: the kind of editor document (hexadecimal, template or interface)
the resource edited by this document
the rezmap document that owns this editor document

Class.ClassDescription: a dedicated interface document editing a resource
a template document editing a resource
a hexadecimal document editing a resource

Property.PropertyDescription: the index of the resource within its type (in the order used by the resource manager)
the index of the resource within its type (in the order used by the resource manager)

Class.ClassDescription: a resource editing window (hexadecimal, template or interface)

Property.PropertyDescription: the kind of the editing window (hexadecimal, template or interface)
all properties of the 'editing window' class
all properties of the 'editing window' class
all properties of the 'editing window' class
the value of the 'System Heap' checkbox
the resource for which info is currently displayed
the reference number of the map in memory
the list of all types (in alphabetical order)
the global value of the map attributes (sum of the individual flags)
the index of the type in the document (types are ordered alphabetically)
a type as a long unsigned integer
the list of all IDs of resources belonging to this type

Class.ClassDescription: a single resource with specific type and ID

Property.PropertyDescription: the type of the resource as text
the index of the resource within its type (in the order used by the resource manager)
the global value of the resource attributes (sum of the individual flags)
the size of the resource data (in bytes)
the size of the resource on disk

Class.ClassDescription: the result of a comparison between two maps

Property.PropertyDescription: resources which are only in the old map
resources which are only in the new map
resources which are in both maps and are different
resources which are in both maps and are identical

Class.ClassDescription: a two-elements list containing the type and the ID for a resource
